title.narrative: Information and Communications Infrastructure Development Project

description.narrative: The project's long-term development objectives are to: (a) significantly increase the coverage and use of relevant ICT services among the rural population through an incentive program designed to encourage the participation of private operators in the rural segment of the ICT market; and (b) increase private sector participation in the delivery of e-Government services, thereby improving public sector utilization of ICT.

condition.narrative: Certification mechanism for financing (capital subsidies, Part A) applied
Certification mechanism for financing (capital subsidies, Part A), approved by 12/31/06
PIU: Maintain and fund throughout life of project.
PSC: Maintain throughout life of project.
Project Implementation Manual: Adopt and apply.

title.narrative: Continued additional annual investment in the ICT sector
Increased number of telephony minutes originated in rural areas outside of soum centers (herder network)
Component 1: Increased number of herder communities with access to telephony services
Component 3: Number of CIOs of ministries, agencies and aimags trained
Number of Government ministries and agencies willing to accept the PPP model for e-Government
Number of e-Government services provided in partnership with the private sector
Component 3: Number of Government ministries/agencies with personnel trained in PPPs
Increased number of telephony minutes originated in soum centers with about 1,000 (or more) inhabitants
Component 1: Increased number of soum centers with about 1,000 or more inhabitants with access to digital telephony services
Component 1: Increased number of soum centers with about 1,000 or more inhabitants with access to Internet services

comment.narrative: All soums have access to mobile data; 34 soums have access to high speed Internet

title.narrative: Increased number of Internet users in soum centers with about 1,000 (or more) inhabitants
Component 2: Increase in percentage of spectrum applications approved and assigned within 15 working days
Component 2: Increase in percentage of regulatory decisions published
Component 3: Percentage of target users using on-line e-Government services in the areas supported by the project
Component 2: Regulatory public consultation process established

actual.value: Contract awarded and to be signed

title.narrative: Component 3: Policy guidelines on PPPs approved

actual.value: Parliament of Mongolia passed policy on PPP in October 2009. Concession and PPP law approved in January 2010

title.narrative: Component 1: Approve legislation to ensure funding for the Universal Service Obligation Fund (USOF)

actual.value: The Law on Government Funds approved in July 2006
